creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: six men in peasant clothing fighting with clubs, swords, daggers, and spears; woven fence with grapevines in background
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Label

-- inscribed in plate in banner: [HAVST DU MICH. SO STICH ICH DICH]
-- numbered in plate at upper left edge: 9
-- in graphite on verso: 7862 [with superscript \"2\"] | P185 I/II
-- in graphite on mount: P7439 / 1 of 6 
-- in graphite on back of mount: XP7439
-- label on mount: Christopher Mendez, 58 Jermyn Street London SW1Y 6LP / Telephone 01-491 0015
provenance: [Christopher Mendez, London; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, upper center: [HSB] ; date in plate at top under banner: [1547]
title: Peasants' Brawl, From Peasant Festival and Twelve Months, Plate 9
